channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: British tourists heading home from Spain react angrily over bombshell two-week quarantine plan
item.description: Queues of home-bound Britons today reacted with anger and confusion as they prepared to board a plane from Madrid's Barajas airport this morning.

item.title: 'We cannot apologise': Dominic Raab DEFENDS decision to axe quarantine-free travel to Spain
item.description: The Foreign Secretary defended the decision by the Department for Transport to remove the country from a list of safe destinations in the wake of a spike in coronavirus cases.

item.title: Labour anti-Semitism whistleblowers could drop legal action if it expels former leader Jeremy Corbyn
item.description: Some ex-party staff now poised to take part in multi-millionpound lawsuits against Labour say they will drop their claims if the former leader is thrown out of the party.

item.title: We'll build a Boohoo factory in Leicester to end storm over pay, says boss
item.description: In a radical plan, Boohoo boss John Lyttle wants to build a 'model factory' in Leicester. It is part of a strategy that he says could seek to emulate the success of Zara owner Inditex.

item.title: Father, 34, whose cancer was untreatable chose to die at home surrounded by his wife and children
item.description: Maxine Mutter, 29, has revealed how her husband Chris Mutter, 34, from Fife, died on June 29 after an eight-month battle with oesophageal cancer, which doctors previously thought was acid reflux.

item.title: Air taxis are the new way to travel - and it's far cheaper than you might think
item.description: Operating out of more than 500 airfields in the UK, Wingly puts 'hobby pilots' in touch with passengers who are asked to help share the cost of fuel and take-off/landing charges.

item.title: French police investigate Rwandan refugee, 39, after he admitted arson attack on Nantes cathedral
item.description: The 39-year-old man is currently under investigation after admitting he was responsible for the fire which tore through the 15th-century building during questioning.

item.title: Car ploughs into crowd near train station in Berlin
item.description: One person was 'trapped underneath a black Mercedes' after it swerved from the road and hit pedestrians in Berlin 's Hardenbergplatz, outside the Bahnhof Zoo station.

item.title: Woman transforms drab bathroom into a millennial pink wet-room
item.description: Kate Spiers, from Glasgow, wowed social media users when she revealed her incredible bathroom transformation after renovating the drab room into a stunning millennial pink bathroom.

item.title: Harry Dunn's parents DROP legal action against Northamptonshire Police
item.description: His family are set for a two-day judicial review hearing at the High Court in November where they allege Dominic Raab 'obstructed justice' by allowing suspect Anne Sacoolas to leave the UK.

item.title: Ramsay: Covid will kill off weak chains
item.description: He claims the coronavirus crisis will 'flush away the unwanted' in his industry amid 'very testing times'. It is predicted 30,000 pubs and restaurants may close for good.
item.media:credit: FOX Image Collection via Getty I

item.title: TOM BOWER: Prince Charles has shown great warmth and generosity to Meghan Markle
item.description: TOM BOWER: Today, we are witnessing the slow destruction of Harry, a much-loved Prince, and it is a tragedy. The fun-loving young man we used to know seems a distant memory.

item.title: Israeli security forces blast protesters with water in demonstration against Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: Israeli security forces blasted protestors with water cannons in west Jerusalem as thousands held demonstrations against Benjamin Netanyahu across the country on Saturday.

item.title: Bodgers beware: That DIY disaster could cost you £2,000
item.description: Research shows that almost a third of households have ended up paying for a professional when DIY tasks have failed.

item.title: Cops declare Seattle protest a riot as youth detention center goes up in flames
item.description: A protester was shot and killed in a shooting at a protest in Texas Saturday night as tensions flared across America.

item.title: UK Weather: Washout weekend continues as Britain braces for more thunder and heavy rain
item.description: Despite it being the height of summer, the windy and unsettled conditions are expected to continue well into next week, with rain forecast until Thursday.

item.title: Kanye West confidently declares he will beat Joe Biden with write-in votes
item.description: Kanye visited a local emergency room in Wyoming Saturday as he issued an apology to Kim Kardashian saying he knows he 'hurt' her following a week of rambling Twitter posts.

item.title: HETHERINGTON: We can't pay in our son's prize because he has no bank account
item.description: My son, now aged 36, has severe autism and epilepsy. When he was a baby, his grandparents bought him a £10 premium bond, and this has now won a £25 prize.

item.title: TV presenter Anna Ryder Richardson: My zoo has lost a fortune
item.description: TV presenter Anna Ryder Richardson is struggling to make ends meet after buying a zoo that had to close during lockdown.

item.title: Wayne Rooney fears Coleen Rooney's legal battle against Rebekah Vardy has 'gone too far'
item.description: Wayne Rooney reportedly fears the legal battle his wife Coleen is embroiled in with Rebekah Vardy for allegedly leaking false information to the press has 'gone too far'.

item.title: It's really war! Coleen Rooney hires Johnny Depp's barrister
item.description: Mrs Rooney has instructed David Sherborne to fight claims she defamed Mrs Vardy with allegations that personal information was leaked from her private Instagram account to a newspaper.

item.title: Duelling duchesses were 'never friends': Meghan was 'disappointed' Kate did not reach out or visit
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex and the Duchess of Cambridge were 'never friends' according to an explosive new book which is causing ructions within the royal household.

item.title: Amanda Holden's outfits are strikingly similar to those Julia Roberts has worn in her films
item.description: Amanda Holden's Instagram snaps have included one of her in a polka-dot dress similar to that worn by Julia in Pretty Woman.

item.title: John Saxon dead at 83: actor best known for roles in Enter The Dragon and Nightmare On Elm Street
item.description: The Brooklyn, New York native played a wide array of characters and ethnicities in more than 200 movie and television appearances over a span of about 60 years.

item.title: Monkey business at Knowsley Safari Park after baboons are seen armed with knives and screwdrivers
item.description: Animal keepers at a safari park in Merseyside believe that some visitors are 'arming' baboons with tools such as knives, screwdrivers and a chainsaw to wreak havoc on parked cars.

item.title: Asthmatic 20-stone father who gorged on family-size trifles sheds eight stone in just 12 months
item.description: Ad van der Rest, 56, from Maidenhead, said his lightbulb moment happened as he watched his daughter run the Brighton marathon last year - while he 'gasped for breath'.

item.title: Black and ethnic minority figures set to feature on British coins for first time
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is considering proposals by campaigners to have influential BAME people featured on a set of coins, Treasury minister John Glen told The Sunday Telegraph .

item.title: Find it hard to get your way? Two of the world's top psychologists give their life-changing tips
item.description: We advise and train the British police and security agencies, and the FBI and CIA in the US, on how to deal with dangerous suspects when the stakes are high, writes Emily and Laurence Alison.

item.title: Minister Grant Shapps faces quarantine over Spanish holiday
item.description: Transport minster Grant Shapps will have to endure a two-week quarantine after returning from Spain, just days after securing an air corridor with the country.

item.title: Now TEN schools tell pupils to wear face masks for when they return in September
item.description: Schools are flouting official guidance by requiring pupils to wear face masks when they return in September, The Mail on Sunday has learned.

item.title: UK will defend itself against Chinese and Russian space weapons
item.description: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace (pictured) said it will lead to 'pivoting away' from a focus on conventional warfare to 'operate much more in the newest domains of space, cyber and sub-sea'.

item.title: Queen attends unveiling of a new portrait of herself by Zoom video call
item.description: The Queen attended a Zoom call unveiling of a new portrait of herself by Miriam Escofet, which was commissioned by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office as a tribute to her service.

item.title: Forrest Fenn reveals his famed $3million treasure chest was found in Wyoming
item.description: Art dealer Forrest Fenn said that he revealed the treasure was found in Wyoming to help 'bring some closure to those whose solves were in New Mexico, Colorado, or Montana.'

item.title: Sinead McNamara death veiled in questions coroner says after body found on Mayan Queen IV in Greece
item.description: Australian model Sinead McNamara, 20, was ruled to have committed suicide after her body was found on the Mayan Queen IV, in the Greek Islands, in August 2018.

item.title: Boris Johnson tells fat Britons to get on their bikes and lose weight
item.description: The Prime Minister intends to put daily exercise front and centre of his new 'Better Health' drive targeting the 35 million Britons estimated to be overweight.

item.title: Nigerian fraudster must be flown back to the UK after his deportation was ruled unlawful by a judge
item.description: The conman was jailed for four-and-a-half years and deported in 2018, but a judge has ordered the Home Office to fly him back to Britain.

item.title: Speed limits will be raised on sections of motorway affected by roadworks to cut journey times
item.description: Highways England said that typical 50mph restrictions where roadworks are taking place will increase to 60mph after trials over the past 18 months found safety could be maintained.

item.title: Will Prince Andrew be named in new sex dossier?
item.description: Release of the documents would be a blow to Maxwell (right) as they feature testimony she gave after Virginia Roberts (centre) claimed she was forced to have sex with Prince Andrew (left).

item.title: Princess Beatrice and her new husband head across the Channel for a low-key French honeymoon
item.description: Princess Beatrice and her new husband Edoardo 'Edo' Mapelli Mozzi, pictured together on their wedding wedding day on July 17, have been spotted driving together in the south of France.

item.title: Tormented father reveals his five-year plight to save his daughter, 9, from a cult
item.description: It is only today, following an extraordinary five-year legal battle, that Graham has finally been able to win back custody of his daughter from his former partner and the sinister Universal Medicine cult.

item.title: Will BBC chiefs get nasty and difficult over Stacey Dooley's Nice 'n' Easy cash?
item.description: Stacey Dooley faces a showdown with Corporation bosses after signing a lucrative deal to advertise haircare products that one inside called a 'head-on conflict of interest'.

item.title: PC Harper's widow Lissie, 29, tells of anguish in heartbreaking letter on their wedding anniversary
item.description: Lissie Harper, the widow of PC Andrew Harper, poured her heart out in a letter to the brave constable to mark what would have been their first wedding anniversary.

item.title: TOM MANGOLD: The BBC's bizarre obsession with wokeness will end as a fatal act of self-harm
item.description: TOM MANGOLD: Churchill was described in last Tuesday's report as the 'precipitator of the mass killing' - that he personally made the situation much worse.

item.title: Channel 4 star Ant Middleton faces the sack as Chief Cadet of the Royal Navy over BLM comments
item.description: Channel 4 star of 'SAS: Who Dares Wins' Ant Middleton (pictured) and former Special Forces trooper is facing the sack for calling Black Lives Matter campaigners 'absolute scum'.

item.title: Diana's biographer said she would be 'devastated' to see William and Harry fall out
item.description: Princess Diana's biographer Andrew Morton has revealed that the late Princess would be 'devastated' to see that Princes William and Harry had fallen out.

item.title: Tory MPs accuse union chiefs of wanting civil servants to 'stay at home forever'
item.description: Tory MPs reacted with anger after the Public and Commercial Services Union told their members to challenge bosses who ordered them back to their desks.

item.title: Lecturer who was sacked for praising Jewish scientists and German engineers slams woke brigade
item.description: Stephen Lamonby designed Navy torpedoes, satellite-carrying rockets, oil rigs and special effects for Hollywood blockbusters including Saving Private Ryan.

item.title: US is accused of hampering attempts to find a Coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Sarah Gilbert is the brilliant professor of vaccinology at Oxford University whose team is leading the way in developing the first vaccine to protect against Covid-19.

item.title: Harry branded William a 'snob' for warning him about 'this girl' Meghan Markle, biography claims
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge told Harry not to 'rush this' and 'take as much time as you need to get to know this girl' Meghan Markle amid fears he was being 'blindsided by lust'.

item.title: Cilla Black's son releases unseen footage of his late mother
item.description: The Surprise Surprise host, who died aged 72, is seen in the intimate home movie at home in Denham, Buckinghamshire, with her then three-year-old son Robert Willis.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Prince William hit back as biography said they shunned Meghan and Harry
item.description: Close friends of the Cambridges insisted they had 'rolled out the red carpet' for US actress Meghan and 'done all they possible could' to welcome her into the Firm.

item.title: Royal book authors: So where DID all their information come from?
item.description: Omid Scobie described how he 'hugged' Meghan during a farewell in March just hours before she quit Britain and has boasted of enjoying a 'one-on-one' discussion with Harry.

item.title: One in seven Glaswegians admit they NEVER manage to eat five portions of fruit and vegetables a day
item.description: In a nationwide poll of 2,000 people, nearly 40 per cent of Britons admitted they found vegetables 'boring', while 37 per cent said they had never found any veg they actually liked to eat.

item.title: Dominic Cummings is held hostage by the SAS... on base tour
item.description: The Prime Minister's uncompromising chief adviser underwent just this experience last week during a tour of the SAS headquarters, Stirling Lines. (File photo)

item.title: American-born Countess of Carnarvon and friend of the Queen leaves £1m in will after dying aged 83
item.description: Jeanie, Countess of Carnarvon, who died aged 83 in April last year, left almost £1million in her will, bequeathing most of her fortune to her children and grandchildren.

item.title: Millions of swimmers face frustration as 1,000 pools remain closed as operators' funds dry up
item.description: Millions of swimmers face a frustrating wait to get back in the water as most public pools remain closed - even though they have been given the go-ahead to reopen.

item.title: Sheep farmers are forced to dump their fleeces due to coronavirus
item.description: With US-UK trade talks set to resume tomorrow, images have circulated on social media showing desperate sheep farmers forced to dump hundreds of near-worthless fleeces in fields.

item.title: Life in lockdown on Corona Road: Their aptly named street is a snapshot of all our experiences
item.description: The joke is wearing thin on residents of Corona Road, in the London borough of Lewisham, as they face the Covid-19 challenge along with everyone else in less topically named streets.

item.title: Grigory Rodchenkov falsified Russian athletes' drug tests - and his country got an Olympic ban
item.description: Grigory Rodchenkov was allegedly at the heart of Russian drug corruption in July 2013, when a Mail on Sunday investigation named him as central to state-sponsored doping and a cover-up.

item.title: North Korea declares state of emergency after Kim meets advisers to discuss 'first coronavirus case'
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un convened an emergency politburo meeting (pictured) after a person suspected of having COVID-19 entered the country from South Korea illegally this month.

item.title: Analysis of shopping trends reveals regional bias of people's fashion choices
item.description: It sounds like the crudest of regional stereotyping to say that Essex girls favour leopard print blouses or that Geordie blokes wear grey jogging bottoms. Amber Turner is pictured in The Only Way Is Essex.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Model Lottie Moss lets it out... about her ADHD
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Kate Moss has always lived by the mantra 'never complain, never explain' but her younger sister Lottie has bravely decided to reveal her own struggle with mental health.

item.title: Catastrophe star Sharon Horgan opens up about her OCD and how she had anxiety attacks
item.description: Sharon Horgan, 50, says she was racked by anxiety at being separated from her two daughters when she moved to America for five months to work.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: How long will it be before I'm free from the pain of shingles?
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: During lockdown a larger-than-usual number of my patients got shingles. The condition lives dormant in our bodies and can, for a variety of reasons, become reactivated.

item.title: Racism, slurs, hysteria... All for daring to suggest a banana isn't as bad as six spoonfuls of sugar
item.description: BARNEY CALMAN: Two weeks ago, I wrote an article about whether eating a banana was 'the same as' consuming six teaspoons of sugar. But the reaction, online, was vitriolic, to say the least.

item.title: 'I'll be out one day': Sick boast of one of PC Andrew Harper's killers as his family grieve
item.description: The family of PC Andrew Harper have slammed his killer Albert Bowers, 18, for letters he wrote to his family from his cell, complaining that he was bored and boasting 'I'll be out one day'.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Boris Johnson's decision to force us to wear face nappies will kill the high street
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: Forcing passengers to don facial nappies has not led to more travelling by train or bus. I speak here from direct personal experience. Passenger numbers remain pitifully low.

item.title: Naya Rivera's ex husband Ryan Dorsey breaks his silence on the Glee actress' tragic death
item.description: Ryan Dorsey broke his silence on Saturday regarding the tragic passing of his ex wife Naya Rivera in a post shared to his Instagram.

item.title: Nutritionist to Prince Harry Gabriela Peacock on how to re-balance your body after lockdown
item.description: She's the model turned top nutritionist who's credited with getting Prince Harry in shape for his wedding. But right now Gabriela Peacock has a bigger mission: to help us all slim down - and live longer

item.title: Virgin birth? Inconceivable, surely… before DNA testing, it was the story that shocked 1950s Britain
item.description: Emmimarie Jones was convinced that her daughter Monica had been conceived without a man - a claim that scandalised the church and divided the medical profession.Clare Chambers investigates

item.title: White Lines star Laura Haddock, 34, goes house-hunting with her 28-year-old lover Tom Rhys Harries
item.description: Laura Haddock plays Zoe Walker in Netflix's White Lines (left), who investigates her brothers murder in Ibiza, played by boyfriend Tom Rhys Harries, pictured house-hunting together inset.

item.title: Harry and Meghan felt snubbed after the Queen did broadcast WITHOUT the pair's picture on her desk
item.description: According to Finding Freedom, the couple considered it a snub that their picture was absent from the desk in the Green Drawing Room at Buckingham Palace.

item.title: Courtier said 'there's something about Meghan Markle I don't trust'
item.description: Meghan Markle was branded 'Duchess Difficult' by royal courtiers according to a shocking new biography of the former Hollywood actress.

item.title: Meghan Markle felt cast as 'Duchess Different'
item.description: Shortly after Harry and Meghan's marriage in 2018, reports emerged about how Meghan was wasting no time in putting her stamp on The Firm. The former actress would rise at 5am ready for work.

item.title: Charity boss says his reinstatement is a victory against 'cancel culture'
item.description: In a victory against a so-called 'cancel culture', Nick Buckley has returned to his job as chief executive of Mancunian Way after the charity's board of four trustees resigned.

item.title: How Meghan and Harry's PR game failed
item.description: In the months after their fairytale wedding, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex enjoyed blanket adulation and were warmly welcomed wherever they visted in the world.

item.title: SAJID JAVID: We must treat the threat of cyber attacks as seriously as we do terrorists
item.description: SAJID JAVID: It is crucial that we give the police and security services more legal tools. Too often, it feels as if our laws work against a common sense of justice and security.

item.title: Boris Johnson is set to give Britain's treason laws the biggest shakeup since 1695
item.description: Boris Johnson is to give Britain's treason laws the biggest shakeup since 1695 in a bid to counter the growing threat of hostile states like Russia and China.

item.title: The A-team, of high-achieving women all wanting to promote their boss's world vision
item.description: There have been jibes about 'The Vipers' in the Palace - courtiers who undermined Meghan and Harry at every turn. But the Duchess was surrounded by an 'A-team' of high-achieving women.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Has another fashion firm fallen victim to the Kate curse?
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Another of Kate's much-loved fashion labels, Beulah London, has gone into liquidation, leaving creditors almost £1 million out of pocket.

item.title: Why gym fanatics claim measuring time BETWEEN your heart beats can tell you if you're overdoing it
item.description: Those 'in the know' are adding another measurement to their DIY wellness assessment: their heart rate variability, or HRV, which determines the time between each beat, and how that varies.

item.title: The 3D-printed cage that could spare hundreds of Britons from leg amputations
item.description: Unlike traditional last-ditch attempts to save crumbling bones in the lower leg, which involve a brace attached to the outside of the leg via holes in the skin, the cage works internally.

item.title: It's heartbreaking to see Prince Harry's litany of gripes that corroded bonds with William and Kate
item.description: That is why the saddest part of the litany of complaints attributed to Prince Harry in the book Finding Freedom is the split between the brothers and their wives, once known as the 'Fab Four'.

item.title: DAN HODGES: What makes all the rabid Remainers hate 'Lord' Botham so much? He's a winner...
item.description: DAN HODGES: What will it take for the Refusenik Remainers to stop acting like marooned Second World War Japanese soldiers, accept the Brexit campaign is over and acknowledge they lost?

item.title: HUGO VICKERS: Prince Harry should have learned from Diana, you cannot compete with the Queen
item.description: HUGO VICKERS: The Members of the Royal Family have always been there to serve the Queen rather than to compete with her. That is the only way that the Monarchy can function.

item.title: The petrifying moment Covid-19 doctors stopped my twin brother's heart, says DR CHRIS VAN TULLEKEN
item.description: DR CHRIS VAN TULLEKEN: Tears are streaming down my masked, visor-covered face. Because this is not just any patient. He is my brother. We're identical twins - both of us doctors.

item.title: China's Uighur women reveal how the Communist regime turned hospitals in centres of mass murder
item.description: When Amina Mamtimin became pregnant four years ago, she knew she must leave her country or the child would be killed. 'I was very happy to be having a baby but also so scared,' she said.

item.title: New mother, 41, convinced better care in 20s when she suffered anorexia may have spared IVF agony
item.description: I wish doctors had warned me of the long-term effect of ultra-thinness way back in my 20s. If I'd had these insights, perhaps my path to motherhood needn't have been so long, or as painful, says Emma Woolf.

item.title: Civil Service chief tipped for No10 top job 'bent' rules to acquire £30,000 worth of paint
item.description: Civil Service high-flyer Antonia Romeo was at the centre of a fresh bullying storm on Saturday night after a former colleague broke cover with a slew of new allegations.

item.title: The best places to go wild swimming in the UK, from the Lake District to Wales
item.description: From Lake District classics to distant Welsh wonders and bracing lochs in Scotland's wildest places, the Mail on Sunday's Joe Minihane picks the greatest lakes for a swim.

item.title: Discovering the story behind 4711, the world's most famous eau de Cologne
item.description: Cologne is known for creating the world's most famous eau de Cologne: 4711. The Mail on Sunday's Tamara Hinson visited the city to learn more about its fascinating history.

item.title: Greg Wallace raked in a staggering £1million last year
item.description: Greg Wallace, 55, who is the director of Lobster Enterprises Ltd, paid more than £120,000 in tax meaning it turned over in excess of £1million, according to accounts filed at Companies House.

item.title: Caroline Flack's ex Lewis Burton has grown close to 1D star Louis Tomlinson's sister Lottie
item.description: Caroline Flack's ex-boyfriend Lewis Burton has grown close to Lottie Tomlinson, five months after the Love Island host tragically took her own life, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: Ex-Today show host John Humphrys reveals he didn't vote for the PM
item.description: John Humphrys has revealed that he is 'not a fan' of Boris Johnson but said it was 'complete rubbish' that he dislikes all politicians, in an interview with Times Radio, set to be aired on Sunday.

item.title: LA is 'not a place' for Harry, suggests ex-Vanity Fair editor
item.description: Graydon Carter ran the publication when Meghan Markle announced in an interview with the glossy magazine that her and Harry were 'two people who are really happy and in love'.

item.title: New book claims 'no titles' were used as the Queen played peacekeeper with Prince Harry
item.description: Extracts of the biography, which are being serialised this weekend, detail the intimate lunch between the prince and the Queen on March 1, where the royals were just 'granny and grandson'.

item.title: Meghan Markle told a friend 'I gave up my entire life for this family', book claims
item.description: Extracts from Finding Freedom claim Meghan made the confession in March, months after the couple announced they would 'step down' as senior royals.

item.title: England records 61 more Covid deaths while Scotland reports zero - bringing UK total to 45,738
item.description: Another 61 people were today confirmed to have died of Covid-19 in the UK, as Scotland confirmed zero deaths for the ninth day in a row. NHS England revealed that 25 of today's victims died in its hospitals

item.title: Undercover morality agent SPITS at teenage girls after seeing them without hijab in Iran
item.description: During the heated exchange in Kermanshah, Iran, the man's wife tells the teenagers to apologise to her husband and informs them he can have them arrested. Wearing a hijab is compulsory in Iran.

item.title: Mallorca's cocaine dealers are offering free face masks with drugs at holiday hotspot of Palma
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Drug dealers, who operate in tourist hotspot Palmer, throw in a face mask and a special snorting straw 'free of charge' with each purchase.

item.title: Savvy mum creates fairy playhouse for £100
item.description: Danielle Paterson, 30, from Bedfordshire, told how she wanted a challenge during lockdown. The savvy mum created a stunning fairy playhouse for her daughters - for just £100.

item.title: Doctors post selfies posing in bikinis with beers in backlash against 'sexist' study
item.description: Medics have been flooding social media with snaps of themselves in their swimwear, lounging in pools and enjoying a cocktail or a beer under the hashtag #MedBikini.
